pages.text: The first thing you need to know is that all the machines in Ex Nihilo: Automation require power to run.

pages.title: Input and output
pages.text: Every machine has a minimum of two types of slots, §aGreen§r for output and §9Blue§r for input.

pages.title: Input and output
pages.text: Each side of the machines as a color representing an input or output.

$(br) Currently we have 4 colors representing inputs and outputs: $(br) $(li) §4Power:§r placed on the horizontal sides of the block; $(li) §9Input:§r represented with blue on the top side of the block; $(li) §aOutput:§r represented with green on the bottom side of the block; $(li) §dInput:§r represented with magenta on one of the sides of the block is a secondary input slot;

pages.title: Upgrades
pages.text: Upgrades to improve the Ex Nihilo Automation machines.

$(br) Upgrade slots is another thing that all machines contain. You are limited to 3 slots, and each slot can only contain one upgrade. $(br2) Read more about in $(l:exnihiloauto:upgrades)$(l)$(6)here$(/l)
